intro: Humboltia loranthophylla, commonly known as the Mexican mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is native to Central America and parts of Mexico. The plant has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It relies on its host for water and some nutrients, while still performing photosynthesis. Humboltia loranthophylla plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for birds and insects.
